title: Calories in 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
meta_description: Discover calories in olive oil 1 tbsp, including full nutrition breakdown, fat content, and healthy tweaks for cooking or dressings.
assumptions: Extra virgin olive oil; 1 tbsp = 14 g or 15 ml; pure, no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (extra virgin, refined), brand, and measurement accuracy. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One tablespoon of olive oil provides ~119 kcal, primarily from healthy monounsaturated fats.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Mix with 1 tsp balsamic vinegar for dressing

faqs.q: How many calories in olive oil 1 tbsp?

faqs.a: Yes, mostly monounsaturated fats; 13.5 g total fat per tbsp, with only 1.9 g saturated.

faqs.q: Does olive oil have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No—0 g carbs, 0 g protein; all calories from fat.

faqs.q: Extra virgin vs regular olive oil calories?
faqs.a: Similar at ~119 kcal per tbsp; extra virgin has more antioxidants but same energy.

faqs.q: How to measure 1 tbsp olive oil accurately?
faqs.a: Use a standard measuring spoon; 1 tbsp ≈ 14 g. Pouring can lead to overuse.
